title: House Vote for Net Neutrality 2011
summary: The principle that Internet service providers should enable access to all content and applications regardless of the source, and without favoring or blocking particular products or websites.

title: Senate Vote for Net Neutrality 2011
summary: The principle that Internet service providers should enable access to all content and applications regardless of the source, and without favoring or blocking particular products or websites.

title:
Money in Elections and Voting
 - Campaign Finance Disclosure Requirements
summary: New disclosure requirements for political advertisements and other regulations for the financing of campaigns and political advertisements.

title: DISCLOSE Act
summary: Vote on a motion to invoke cloture on a bill that submits a constitutional amendment to the voters that requires certain organizations involved in political advertising to disclose information on individuals or groups who donate $10,000 or more.

title: Backup Paper Ballots - Voting Record
summary: Vote to pass a bill that provides grants to state and local governments for making backup paper ballots available in the November 2008 election.

title: Sets reasonable limits on the raising and spending of money by electoral candidates to influence elections (Reverse Citizens United)
summary: Authorizes Congress and the States to set “reasonable limits” on the raising and spending of money by electoral candidates to “influence” elections. Authorizes Congress and the States to distinguish between individuals and corporations or other entities in legislation, including by prohibiting such entities from spending money to “influence” elections.

title: The Economy/Jobs - Limits Interest Rates for Certain Federal Student Loans
summary: limits interest rates for certain federal student loans

title: Student Loan Affordability Act
summary: Vote on a motion to invoke cloture on a bill that extends current interest rates for undergraduate loans until July 1, 2015.

title: Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Funding Amendment
summary: Vote on an amendment that increases appropriations for the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program by $1.28 billion and decreases the amount of discretionary funds appropriated in all appropriation acts this year by .92 percent.

title: End the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection
summary: Vote to adopt an amendment that terminates the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection and its authority 4 years after the date of enactment, unless extended by an Act of Congress.

title: Kill Credit Default Swap Regulations
summary: Vote on a motion to table an amendment to S Amdt 4072 to S 3217 that establishes new restrictions on activities related to credit default swaps, including prohibiting "naked" credit default swaps.

title: Revokes tax credits for businesses that move jobs overseas
summary: Vote on a motion to invoke cloture on a bill that prohibits tax credits for outsourcing expenses and establishes a tax credit for insourcing expenses

title: Disapproval of President's Authority to Raise the Debt Limit - House Vote
summary: Vote to pass a joint resolution that disapproves of the President's exercise of authority to increase the debt limit of the United States.

title: Disapproval of President's Authority to Raise the Debt Limit - Senate Vote
summary: Vote to pass a joint resolution that disapproves of the President's exercise of authority to increase the debt limit of the United States.

title: Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act - House Vote
summary: Vote to pass a bill that redefines unlawful employment laws and counts each paycheck as an offense if a salary is ruled as discriminatory.

title: Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act - Senate Vote
summary: Vote to pass a bill that redefines unlawful employment laws and counts each paycheck as an offense if a salary is ruled as discriminatory.
